what: An R package for the IUCN Red List API
title: An R package for the IUCN Red List API
text: International Union Conservation Nature’s Red List Threatened Species evolved become world’s comprehensive information source global conservation status animal, fungi plant species. ’s critical indicator health world’s biodiversity. IUCN Red List API developed inform drive biodiversity conservation policy change -— critical steps protecting essential natural resources. provides programmatic access data including (limited ); population size, habitat ecology, trade threats help support informed conservation decisions. iucnredlist R package aims serve client library Red List API, offering research community users efficient user-friendly tool access interact vital data services provided IUCN Red List. open sourced package promote transparency, enable research community contributions, drive adoption API. official IUCN-supported library, shall maintain synchronisation API changes updates. proponents tidyverse worked ensure outputs iucnredlist functions conform tidy data principles possible.

title: An R package for the IUCN Red List API
text: use API falls Terms Use Red List. requesting token, agreeing abide Terms Use Red List. token usage found breach terms use, revoked. kindly request cooperation ensuring responsible respectful usage services. Please aware misusing API token, using information extraction (scraping) rather making legitimate requests non-commercial purposes, may result token rate limited /revoked. committed maintaining high-quality service users implemented rate limiting system ensure resources accessible equally . actively monitor API usage prevent abuse. understand users may unique requirements making frequent calls succession. find situation, kindly request incorporate appropriate delays API calls ensure smooth operation prevent overloading system, otherwise token may rate-limited. ’s important note Red List API primarily designed support conservation efforts, particularly fields education research. may need restrict access API used purposes align mission, mobile app development, inclusion computing courses, visualization projects unrelated conservation. Use Red List API commercial purposes strictly forbidden. Users wish use Red List data commercial purposes consider subscribing IBAT.

title: An R package for the IUCN Red List API
text: committed ensuring fast reliable access users API. end, implemented rate limiting maintain service reliability users. Several functions within package argument called wait_time - recommend setting >=0.5 seconds (default 0.5 seconds) avoid rate limiting. build functions package, recommend implement appropriate wait time code avoid limits.

title: An R package for the IUCN Red List API
text: iucnredlist package contains number functions allow quick access Red List data. examples quick-start scripts get familiar basic iucnredlist workflow. running code, must first sign Red List API obtain API token. can view (cycle) token account page.

what: Fetch data for a single assessment
title: An R package for the IUCN Red List API
code: # Initialize the API with your API key api <- init_api("your_red_list_api_key")  # Fetch assessment data for assessment_id = 266696959 (Panthera leo) # Returns a list containing all assessment data assessment_raw <- assessment_data(api, 266696959)  # Parse the 'raw' assessment data to tidy tibbles assessment <- parse_assessment_data(assessment_raw)  # View e.g. threats or habitats # The result is a tidy 'tibble()` of data assessment$threats assessment$habitats

what: Fetch all assessments for an SIS taxon ID
title: An R package for the IUCN Red List API
code: # Initialize the API with your API key api <- init_api("your_red_list_api_key")  # Get 'minimal' assessment data for the European Sturgeon sturgeon <- assessments_by_sis_id(api, 230)

what: Gather full assessment data for many assessment IDs
title: An R package for the IUCN Red List API
code: # Using the sturgeon assessment IDs from above example, get full assessment data sturgeon_all <- assessment_data_many(api, sturgeon$assessment_id)  # View theats sturgeon_threats <- extract_element(sturgeon_all, "threats")

what: Fetch all assessments for a Latin binomial name
title: An R package for the IUCN Red List API
code: # Initialize the API with your API key api <- init_api("your_red_list_api_key")  # Get all historic and latest assessments for Panthera leo (not case-sensitive) lion <- assessments_by_name(api, genus = "panthera", species = "leo")

what: Show threats for a taxonomic level
title: An R package for the IUCN Red List API
code: # Initialize the API with your API key api <- init_api("your_red_list_api_key")  # Step 1: Get all latest and global-scope assessment IDs for the family Felidae felidae <- assessments_by_taxonomy(api,   level = "family",   name = "felidae",   latest = TRUE,   scope_code = 1,   wait_time = 0.5 )  # Step 2: Fetch assessment data for each assessment ID # Pass the assessment_id column to `assessment_data_many() to grab # full assessment data for each assessment_id a_data <- assessment_data_many(api,   felidae$assessment_id,   wait_time = 0.5 )  # Step 3: Extract habitats from the assessment data # This will iterate over each assessment in the list a_data # and return a tidy `tibble()` for all habitats habitats <- extract_element(a_data, "habitats")  # Alternatively, extract threats threats <- extract_element(a_data, "threats")  # See all elements you can extract - use any of these with `extract_element()` element_names()

what: Get minimal assessment data for an API group — assessments_by_group
title: Get minimal assessment data for an API group — assessments_by_group
text: assessment_by_ functions including assessments_by_group() return 'minimal' assessment data specified filters (arguments). minimal assessment data provides assessment_ids sis_taxon_ids (tibble) can used assessment_data(), assessment_data_many() partial_assessment_data() get full assessment data. assessments_by_group() function acts upon API assessment group names codes. Valid names can found calling list_group_names() codes can found list_codes(api, "scopes").

title: Get minimal assessment data for an API group — assessments_by_group
code: assessments_by_group(   api,   group,   code,   year_published = NULL,   latest = TRUE,   scope_code = NULL,   wait_time = 0.5,   show_warnings = TRUE )

title: Get minimal assessment data for an API group — assessments_by_group
text: api httr2 response object created init_api(). group String. valid API group name. Valid names can found calling list_group_names(). code String. valid group code. Valid codes API group can found calling e.g. list_codes(api, "habitats") year_published Integer. publication year wish filter. latest Boolean. Return latest historic assessments. Defaults TRUE. scope_code String. valid assessment scope. Defaults NULL (.e. returns assessments scopes). Valid scope codes can found calling list_codes(api, "scopes"). wait_time Float. Time seconds wait API calls. wait time >=0.5s avoid API rate limiting. show_warnings Boolean. Whether show warning console assessments found specified arguments. Defaults TRUE.

title: Get minimal assessment data for an API group — assessments_by_group
text: Returns tibble() minimal assessment data specified arguments. minimal assessment data provides assessment_ids sis_taxon_ids can used assessment_data(), assessment_data_many() partial_assessment_data() get full assessment data.

text: assessment_by_ functions including assessments_by_taxonomy() return 'minimal' assessment data specified filters (arguments). minimal assessment data provides assessment_ids sis_taxon_ids (tibble) can used assessment_data(), assessment_data_many() partial_assessment_data() get full assessment data. assessments_by_taxonomy() returns minimal assessment data given taxonomic hierarchy name.

title: Get minimal assessment data for a taxonomic level — assessments_by_taxonomy
code: assessments_by_taxonomy(   api,   level,   name,   year_published = NULL,   latest = TRUE,   scope_code = NULL,   wait_time = 0.5 )

title: Get minimal assessment data for a taxonomic level — assessments_by_taxonomy
text: api httr2 response object created init_api(). level String. level taxonomic hierachy. Must one : kingdom, phylum, class, order family. name String. name taxonomic hierarchy. year_published Integer. publication year wish filter. latest Boolean. Return latest historic assessments. Defaults TRUE. scope_code String. valid assessment scope. Defaults NULL (.e. returns assessments scopes). Valid scope codes can found calling list_codes(api, "scopes"). wait_time Time seconds wait API calls. wait 0.5 seconds greater ensure hit IUCN Red List API rate limit. Defaults TRUE.

title: Get minimal assessment data for a taxonomic level — assessments_by_taxonomy
text: Returns tibble() minimal assessment data specified arguments. minimal assessment data provides assessment_ids sis_taxon_ids can used assessment_data(), assessment_data_many() partial_assessment_data() get full assessment data.

Parse raw assessment data — parse_assessment_data
text: Transforms list raw assessment data assessment_data() converts opinionated list unnested tibbles. purpose function generate 'tidy' tibbles raw response, feel easier work downstream analyses. Due complexity taxon response, tidied 'taxon' element, moving Common Names, SSC Groups Synonyms named elements list, prepending parts response taxon_. process applied conservation_actions_in_place, nested conservation_actions raw response. Finally, ordered named lists alphabetically. , now, omitted raw response's 'documentation' element mostly long paragraphs text HTML. important work, recommend fetching object created assessment_data() process according needs.
